recommendations: “Shiladitya is intelligent and he grasps the concepts quite easily. This makes him a good resource for any organization where he would work. He has acquired a good understanding of machine learning as a subject and he is good at applying those concepts in practice. Shiladitya, according to me, is a good blend of managerial and technical skills. Due to this blend he is a good candidate for client interactions and client handling. He can understand the client requirements and translate the same into data mining problems to provide data driven solutions. I wish him all the very best for his career.” Show less
projects: [{"title":"Searching LinkedIn using Topic Modelling","start_date":"Jan 2020","end_date":"Apr 2020","description":"Background: There exists a huge asymmetry of information between the candidate pool and recruiter pool. The purpose of the project was to reduce that asymmetry to some extent.Description: A team of 6 people scrapped around 5k LinkedIn profiles, using Selenium and BS4 ( Python API), pre-processed and used Topic Modelling (LDA) to predict topics from the corpus namely Marketing, Finance, Operations and Human Resource. Post that, query entered by the user is fitted by keyword matching and allocated to a topic bucket. Using Jensen Shannon Divergence we picked the top 10 people from the topic bucket that is best described by the query. For Deployment, we used Flask, HTML and CSS ( for building the GUI)Tools used: Python, Flask, Selenium etc. Supervisor: Professor Subhasis Dasgupta, Praxis Business School (Kolkata) [ https://www.linkedin.com/in/subhasis-dasgupta/ ]"},{},{},{},{},{"title":"Diagnostic study of Dark Chocolate segment and accessing market opportunities for AMUL","start_date":"Sep 2018","end_date":"Nov 2018","description":"Background: The dark chocolate segment of AMUL is quite new in the market and compared to its competitors it's not doing so well. So we wanted to understand the reasons and propose a solution to the problem.Description: The project involved 10 in-depth interviews of customers, an online survey of 100 respondents, 3 in-depth interviews of retailers, 2 FGDs each of 6. The work generated a 5 pointers insight and recommended a 3- point improvementSupervisor: Professor Vasant P. Gandhi, IIM AhmedabadRemarks: The project received APPRECIATION from Prof. Vasant Gandhi for identifying key insights from primary survey & recommendation on sub-branding of Amul dark Chocolate, the launch of new SKUs and repositioning of the current product portfolio."},{},{},{"title":"Simulation studies on Origin of Life ( MS thesis)","start_date":"2016","end_date":"2017","description":"Background: The neverending question about how it all came into existence bewilders everyone. Using mathematical modelling the project tried to model the beginning. Description: The project used MATLAB as a tool for Mathematical modelling( Two Company's Model) and create simulations to understand the origin of Life.Supervisor: Professor Supratim Sengupta, IISER Kolkata"}]
